modules.description: Combines and compares style attributes using overloaded operators for addition and subtraction. It works with a custom type `t` representing visual formatting options. Users can check equality, apply standard styles like bold or italic, and manipulate style combinations.

Provides functions to generate and manipulate hints for code completion, including prefix matching and score calculation. Works with strings and custom hint records containing identifiers and metadata. Used to enhance interactive development environments by suggesting relevant symbols during typing.

type t = { advance: int; left_side: int; right_side: int; width: int; height: int } Calculates glyph dimensions and spacing for text rendering, including horizontal and vertical metrics. Processes font data to determine character positioning and visual alignment. Used in layout engines to adjust character spacing and line height in rendered text.

combines style attributes with overloaded operators, manages glyph metrics through a structured type, and supports code hint generation with string and metadata processing. it enables style manipulation, text layout calculations, and interactive code suggestions. users can add or subtract font styles, compute character spacing, and generate relevant symbol hints. operations include checking style equality, calculating glyph dimensions, and scoring partial identifier matches.

Provides functions for loading and rendering TrueType fonts, calculating text dimensions, and setting font style attributes. Works with font files, surfaces, and color values to generate textured representations of text. Used to display dynamic text in games, such as scores, labels, and user interface elements.

manages font styles, glyph metrics, and code hints through structured types and overloaded operations. it supports style arithmetic, text layout calculations, and identifier scoring, enabling precise control over typography and interactive development features. users can adjust font attributes, compute spacing, and generate symbol suggestions. examples include combining bold and italic styles, calculating character width, and improving autocompletion accuracy.
